page.title: 19The River Mersey
page.content:
The River Mersey starts at the Pennines and goes past the Pier Head into the Irish Sea. It is a fast flowing river with a strong current.
{The ferry service operates between {the Pier Head, Liverpool and landing {stages at Birkenhead and Wallasey on {the Wirral. The ferry boats are named {Mountwood, Woodchurch and Overchurch, {plus Royal Iris which is used mainly {for parties, discos and excursions. { { }Once there were nine ferry boats including Wallasey, Marla, St Hilary, John Farley and the Royal Daffodil but the ferries are not used much now because of the two tunnels. The river is mainly used for dredgers, tankers, container ships, fishing boats and the ferries which have been threatened with closure for many years.
